channel.title: Simple question about runescape
channel.description: Could someone please tell me the server ip of a member world and which world it is?

item.title: Simple question about runescape
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

Well, with the prefix + the “runescape.com” he can do all kinds of different things to get the IP. I believe in helping people, but they learn nothing if I do it for them. I assumed along the same lines of Pwnd, that he didn’t know if he wanted the IP address or the actual address. I’ve seen them used incorrectly thousands of times.

Nice cordernites picture too by the way. =]

Read full topic

item.title: Simple question about runescape
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Follow directions.

nou

He asked for an IP, not a prefix :P. To find an ip for a Runescape server, ping the world URL. So enter your cmd and type, for example

ping http://va8.runescape.com

And you get:

217.138.42.36

Congrats, you have now 1337 h4cks in t3h b0x!?

Read full topic

item.title: Simple question about runescape
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

Follow directions. Go to their website, get to the server page, scroll to the members, mouseover the server you want, look in the status window at the bottom of your browser and it will say http://***.runescape.com The *** is your prefix.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple question about runescape
item.dc:creator: @krawks12 krawks12
item.description:
@krawks12 wrote:

I dont get it…

Read full topic

item.title: Simple question about runescape
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

You can do this simply by going to the RS site and look at the urls.

Go to the page, copy the link from one of the worlds and look for this:

***.runescape.com

The ‘***’ is usually three characters, but that isn’t the case all of the time.

Read full topic
